page.title: 07ECOLOGY IN HAMBLEDON
page.content: {SPELTHAM DOWN}is a site of unimproved grassland at the centre of{Hambledon.} Five footpaths cross the down including the{Wayfarer's Way.}In 1984 the land was offered for sale to be split into small plots for pony grazing. The Down is valued as a landscape feature and it was felt that fences and huts would ruin this.The site also has recreational value and an importance for nature conservation. It has a typical chalk flora and provides a habitat that is threatened nationally. A committee was formed to raise the funds for the{National Trust to buy the site and tree preservation orders were requested. Â£26000 were raised by the villagers in 3 months and the{Countryside Commission}gave Â£4000.The site was bought by the Trust for Â£40000.The land will be managed to preserve its present character.
